channel.title: Where to change home teleport coords [PI]
channel.description: I totally forgot where to change the home teleport coords. Can anyone help?

item.title: Where to change home teleport coords [PI]
item.dc:creator: @PlucScape PlucScape
item.description:
@PlucScape wrote:

h3rbl0re:

Ah, i got it. The home teleport was going off of the edgeville teleport, so i need to change it to “Config.START_LOCATION_X, Config.START_LOCATION_Y”

On my server I don’t even have that kind of code.
I maybe read too fast your original post, but I haven’t seen you refer your server source. You should’ve if you haven’t.

That would’ve helped me help you

Good day

Read full topic
item.source: Where to change home teleport coords [PI]

item.title: Where to change home teleport coords [PI]
item.dc:creator: @PlucScape PlucScape
item.description:
@PlucScape wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Log in and press the home teleport button.

If it sends a message, search for the message in ClickingButtons. If it doesn’t send a message, search for the coordinates in ClickingButtons.

To get your coordinates, either use the ::mypos command if you have it, or log out once you have teleported, and then look at your character files.[/quote]

Most likely, you can also get your coordinates in the tab with a man who seems to be running (Rs3 emotes tab).
To change where you will get when you get teleported to home, go in your client.java file. Other than that, I don’t see what could be it. also if this didn’t answer your question, try searching in your whole server folder for the coordinates you get to when you teleport to home.

Good luck.

Read full topic

item.description:
@rash wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]^ That’s usually only for changing the login spawn.

@OP If the above comment doesn’t work, try ClickingButtons.[/quote]

Thats the home teleportation aswell.

item.title: Where to change home teleport coords [PI]
item.dc:creator: @EzioAuditori EzioAuditori
item.description:
@EzioAuditori wrote:

Go to server and open the file Config.java.

Then search for

and change the part after the equals sign to whatever the X coordinate of the home location is.
Then do the same for the START_LOCATION_Y coordinate just below it.

and if you want the home location to be the Respawn point also then change the RESPAWN_X and RESPAWN_Y to the same coords.

Read full topic
